nah, we really need to walk to and take the baron

Lol I got flamed for saying we should take inhib before baron. We pushed the wave up to their turret then they all left me to take Baron. I was support so I couldn't do anything to take the dumb tower/inhib and then my team all died right after taking baron because the enemy revived. I got out and had baron buff still but they were too busy flaming me instead of grouping so the buff expired and we lost after another 10 or so minutes

"The baron buff will help us take the inhib bronze noob"
It's the other way around :[

Yeah you probably made the right call of pushing first, but since your team decided to do baron you probably should have gone with them. Since you didn't take tower/inhib you were kind of wasting time when you could have done more somewhere else.
It's a different game, but in CS:GO, its normally better just to follow a call than to argue over a call you know is better - teamwork is key

baron vs inhib tower and inhib is a tough call; sometimes rushing baron is better (if you can kill it uncontested vs being left trying to finish off tower or inhib at when team is half hp and enemy team all respawned full hp to defend), sometimes it is better to inhib recall, and use superminion pressure to baron. But if team argues or is indecisive it is generally worse than being decisive even if you make the wrong call decisively.
its 10 min into the game noob; we have to take rift herald. but first, let me get wolf camp{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I've always actually found that call hard, because Both turrets > inhib > Baron > One turret.

If you can take both turrets and make it an open nexus do it, but if they already have an broken inhib but you don't think you can open nexus then Baron is probably the better call.
with a jhin, ye u can

Im not even joking I had a game a while back were we aced them or got close too, all we had to do was push and tank their hits through 2 nexus towers/the nexus and win the game. Then they went to do baron and they proceeded to push on our base, I got basically 1 shot by ryze and game was over. I was playing with a friend and he was the one who went baron, you can imagine it didn't blow over well.

I've never really understood how it's actually difficult to CONVINCE people to do baron after getting 2 kills. It's 5 vs 3, team cant get an inhibitor, baron is up = kill baron. Unless MAYBE you are too low against baron pit nuke champs with like {{champion:41}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:115}} 

Yet people will just like walk away to do 50% of the mid inner turrets life before the enemy spawns and you get nothing

Had a zed in a platinum game who refused to help us end game on two opportunities after won teamfights because he wanted to baron, and would go there and stand by himself doing nothing if no one would follow him.

> [{quoted}](name=Vumamil,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=xlR5vgAu,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2017-02-17T07:31:50.198+0000)
>
> Had a zed in a platinum game who refused to help us end game on two opportunities after won teamfights because he wanted to baron, and would go there and stand by himself doing nothing if no one would follow him.

Then go do baron. No game is ever lost by one player. If 1 person is standing at baron and refuses to help then swallow your pride, do baron, and move on to finishing the game.
We won that game. But 1 player can definitly lose a game... not sure where you're getting that. That zed had to game on a razors edge due to poor decision making.
My team actually won a game we were losing hard because the enemy fed {{champion:55}}  decided to take blue buff while the rest of her team was fighting at dragon.
